metadata.title: CVE-2021-38161 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Improper Authentication vulnerability in TLS origin verification of ApacheTraffic Server allows for man in the middle attacks. This issue affectsApache Traffic Server 8.0.0 to 8.0.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38161` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 9.1.3+ds-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 9.1.3+ds-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.1.3+ds-1').
